metadata.title: CVE-2022-36320 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 102. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could havebeen exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox <103.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
